title: Ethiopian Lentil Stew
directions: Use 'Saute' on your pressure cooker and heat your oil. Once shimmering, add the ginger, garlic, red onion, & green onion.
Cook the onions, ginger, and garlic for around 3 minutes, until softened. Then add the cumin powder, berbere spice, and salt. Stir to combine.
Add the tomato paste and red lentils, stir for 30 seconds.Â Then add 4.5 cups vegetable broth and close the lid.
Press the soup button and cook on high pressure for 6 minutes, with the pressure valve in the sealing position.
Quick release the pressure and then press the saute button.
Add the remaining 1 cup of the vegetable broth (Depending on desired consistency) and stir in the spinach leaves.
Let it simmer for 1 minutes or until the spinach leaves have wilted.
Serve over a bed of rice.
ingredients: A handful of baby spinach leaves
